div.p: I think where I’d sort of done an apprenticeship and hadn’t gone to college there wasn’t really any surprises because you’re learning in
the environment you’re going to be working in so the surprises you get are sort of you’re not getting taught... It’s hard to explain without
making any sense but because you’re working in that environment the surprises that come along you just deal with as a part of it
whereas if you’re sort of training in college they can’t tell you anything like that can they you just get taught the basics, how to type a letter or, you know,
how to pay an invoice but when you do it in a work environment if someone comes in and starts kicking up a fuss you’re dealing with it
there and then as you’re learning so it’s not really a surprise I guess and there’s always someone there, you know, you can turn to
if it’s above your head, your line manager, to go to for help so no, no real surprises.
